labels.analysis: The MCP Server described specializes in converting Figma design files into React component structures, enabling design-to-code workflows. It integrates with the Figma API to extract design data (including styles, layouts, and assets) and processes them into React-compatible formats. This automates a critical part of the front-end development process, particularly for designers and developers working with Figma-based designs. The available tools suggest capabilities in extracting file content and retrieving image URLs from Figma files.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around code-generation and integration, which are central to the development workflow. The secondary labels "API Integration" and "Web Design" reflect the server's reliance on the Figma API and its focus on UI/UX development, respectively. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Figma Design to React Converter
server_info_crawled.author: @sanjeev23oct/figma-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Convert Figma design files into React-ready component structures with pixel-perfect fidelity. Fetch and process Figma file content, styles, layouts, and assets into React-compatible formats, enabling seamless UI development. Simplify design-to-code workflows by integrating Figma API data directly into your React projects.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@sanjeev23oct/figma-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
